newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open firmer.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open firmer.

text.p: New York precious metals futures were called to open slightly firmer Tuesday as the bullion market continued to consolidate overnight following last week's slide.
COMEX April gold was called unchanged to $0.20 firmer from Monday's close of $348.50 an ounce. It traded from $347.50 to $348.90 on ACCESS.
In the bullion market, spot gold was quoted at $346.30/70 after fixing at $346.30 in London this morning compared to the New York close Monday at $346.40/90.
Concerns about European central bank sales continues, traders said. A still-strong dollar is pressuring demand for gold in other currencies and Chinese New Year will depress demand temporarily too.
But the market became oversold temporarily last week after the break below $350 to a fresh three-year low and needs to consolidate again, analysts said.
COMEX gold stocks rose 20,319 ounces Monday to 837,074 ounces.
COMEX March silver was called unchanged to 0.3 cent firmer from Monday's close of $4.902.
COMEX silver stocks rose 600,050 ounces Monday to 195,449,509 ounces.
NYMEX April platinum was called unchanged to $0.30 higher from the previous close of $355.70, with NYMEX March palladium called unchanged to down $0.30 from Monday's close of $128.80.
